intro: Andreusia guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupensis milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. The plant serves as a host for certain butterfly species and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
